usefulItems: plastic wrap, baking paper, , 2 baking trays, silicone bread mat, , rolling pin, pastry brush, oven
title: Tuna and Olive Empanaditas

ingredients.content: 2 pieces lemon zest, no white pith (5 x 1 cm)
150 g brown onion, cut into halves
100 grams red peppers, deseeded and cut into eighths
80 g green peppers, deseeded and cut into eighths
185 g tinned tuna in oil, drained

preparations.content: Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and place eggs into it. Cook <b>14 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set eggs aside to cool. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place lemon zest and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining filling ingredients, except tuna, and chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>, then cook <b>10 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>.
Add drained tuna and cook <b>5 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Transfer tuna mixture into a large bowl and set aside to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Peel boiled eggs, then place peeled egg into mixing bowl and mix <b>2 sec//speed 4<b>. Transfer into large bowl with the tuna mixture and stir to combine. Cover mixture and place into refrigerator to cool completely (approx.1-2 hours).

hintsAndTricks: Empanaditas can be frozen at the end of step 11 (prior to baking). Remove from the freezer to defrost for a minimum 1 hour prior to baking, then proceed as per recipe.

The pastry circles can be pre-made and frozen. Layer the circles between squares of baking paper to separate, then freeze in a freezable container. The tuna filling can be made a day in advance. Simply cover and place into the refrigerator at the end of step 5 until required.
Make the most of any leftovers by combining any leftover tuna filling and tinned chopped tomatoes before tossing through fresh pasta.
